React: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It uses a component-based approach where UI elements are broken down into reusable components. React efficiently updates and renders components as data changes, resulting in a fast and interactive user interface.
Angular: A TypeScript-based framework developed by Google. Angular provides a complete solution for building large-scale web applications. It follows a component-based architecture and offers features like two-way data binding, dependency injection, and a robust set of tools for testing and building applications.
Vue js: A progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces. Vue.js focuses on the view layer and provides a basic and intuitive API. It employs a virtual DOM and reactive data binding to efficiently update the UI. Vue.js can be gradually adopted and integrated into existing projects.
jQuery: A fast, small, and feature-rich JavaScript library. jQuery simplifies HTML document traversal, event handling, and animation. It provides an easy-to-use API for manipulating the DOM and making AJAX requests. Although its popularity has declined with the rise of modern frameworks, jQuery is still used in many legacy projects.
lodash: A utility library that provides a wide range of helper functions for working with arrays, objects, and other data types. lodash simplifies common programming tasks and enhances code readability. It offers methods for iteration, manipulation, and functional programming, making JavaScript development more productive.
Axios: A popular HTTP client library that simplifies making AJAX requests from JavaScript. Axios provides an easy-to-use API for performing asynchronous operations and handling HTTP responses. It supports features like interceptors, request cancellation, and automatic conversion of response data.
